----- Original Message -----
From: "S. Alexander Jacobson" <alex@...>

>
> If each user gets his/her own URL then this is
> equivalent to passing a name/password with each
> request.
Except that the name is not visible to intermediaries as being a username,
and that users have no incentive to not share this URL with others.
However, if the name/password pair is also bound to the specific resource,
then you could disable that particular password when you like, without
affecting other resources - similar to 'capabilities'.
